body_html:
@AshishBora @alisidd What do you guys think about going in this direction?
https://github.com/siryog90/tensorflow/commit/28ac4a10707542ff95380dc0eaa8933ff7f5a58f

Graph's create_op function can then check if a ContextGraph is defined, and if so, call a create_pseudo_op of the ContextGraph.

We can let a ContextGraph accept a Graph as an argument to the constructor, and have it build the necessary graph from end to end.
body_text:
@AshishBora @alisidd What do you guys think about going in this direction?
https://github.com/siryog90/tensorflow/commit/28ac4a10707542ff95380dc0eaa8933ff7f5a58f
Graph's create_op function can then check if a ContextGraph is defined, and if so, call a create_pseudo_op of the ContextGraph.
We can let a  ContextGraph accept a Graph as an argument to the constructor, and have it build the necessary graph from end to end.
body:
@AshishBora @alisidd What do you guys think about going in this direction? 
https://github.com/siryog90/tensorflow/commit/28ac4a10707542ff95380dc0eaa8933ff7f5a58f

`Graph's` `create_op` function can then check if a `ContextGraph` is defined, and if so, call a `create_pseudo_op` of the `ContextGraph`.

We can let a  `ContextGraph` accept a `Graph` as an argument to the constructor, and have it build the necessary graph from end to end.
